alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 14 at 4:00AM CDT until October 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF EASTERN OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Pittsburg, Haskell, Latimer, and Le Flore counties. In Oklahoma, Osage, Washington, Nowata, Craig, Ottawa, Pawnee, Tulsa, Rogers, Mayes, Delaware, Creek, Okfuskee, Okmulgee, Wagoner, Cherokee, Adair, Muskogee, McIntosh, and Sequoyah counties. * WIND...West to west-southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts to around 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon values 15 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Low to mid 80s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
